actionUnits.condition: HouseController (MonoBehaviour guid: 340adb04e4e259e4b9c3e716ea2e6ced) is attached to House. Scene config matches script fields: windowGlassObjects[4], lightsOnEmissionColor, lightsOffEmissionColor, lightStatus=false (default), switchSound -> component fileID 821553098848002450. This step explicitly invokes the public no-arg method to apply currentLightStatus=false emission to all windowGlassObjects.

Before triggering, set HouseController.lightStatus = true (via inspector, UI binding, or another game event). Expected: in Update(), currentLightStatus != lightStatus, so currentLightStatus becomes true, changeLights() is called automatically, and switchSound.Play() is invoked. This wait allows Update to run.

Before triggering, set HouseController.lightStatus = false (via inspector, UI binding, or another game event). Expected: in Update(), currentLightStatus != lightStatus, so currentLightStatus becomes false, changeLights() is called automatically to set lightsOffEmissionColor, and switchSound.Play() is invoked. This wait allows Update to run.

Proceed only if GameObject 'Island' (fileID 1300569560) has a Collider, an EventTrigger component, or its attached MonoBehaviour (component fileID 1300569562) exposes UnityEvents (m_Calls) or public no-arg methods. The scene snippet did not include the MonoBehaviour serialization or any Collider/EventTrigger, so we need the exact serialized MonoBehaviour (fileID 1300569562) including script class/assembly/GUID, its UnityEvent m_Calls, and any public no-parameter methods; plus confirmation of Collider presence and Has_Event_Trigger flag. If none exist on 'Island', provide the component details for its children to identify a triggerable target.
